profile_data.summary:
I am pursuing a Master's degree in Computer Science at San Diego State University, I am passionate about applying Machine learning and Data Science techniques to solve real-world problems. With a strong foundation from my Bachelor's in Computer Engineering, I have developed proficiency in Python, C++, SQL, and various machine learning frameworks like Pandas, Numpy, PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Scikit-learn.

Currently, at San Diego State University, I am working as a Student Assistant and a Graduate Research Assistant focusing on advanced machine learning methodologies and their applications as I am working on developing Question & Answering System. I assist a professor in grading presentations, assignments, and projects for the Business Analysis and Design course for graduate students.

Leveraging experience from a transformative internship at The Times of India, I excelled in converting complex data into actionable insights and boosting lead generation strategies. My academic pursuits in Computer Science are fueled by a commitment to bridging theoretical knowledge with tangible innovations in AI and Machine Learning. As a Machine Learning Intern at 1Stop, I explored dimensionality reduction techniques and ensured high model accuracy through robust data preprocessing.

Some key projects include a Sanskrit Automatic Speech Recognition System and a Zomato Restaurant Analysis and Rating Prediction model, where I applied deep learning models such as LSTMs and Random Forests to enhance predictive capabilities.

Recognized as a finalist in the Smart India Hackathon, I have also published research on Sanskrit voice-to-text conversion. My technical expertise and strong analytical mindset allow me to contribute effectively to data-driven solutions. 

My goal is to bridge the gap between theoretical research and real-world applications, particularly in Machine learning, Artificial intelligence, and Data Science. I am eager to collaborate on projects that challenge the status and push the boundaries of what's possible in technology.

Let's connect and explore potential opportunities to collaborate on exciting projects!

Skills:
Languages: Python, SQL, C/C++, Java, HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Frameworks & Libraries: Pandas, NumPy, MATLAB, NLTK, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, Keras, TensorFlow, SciPy, OpenCV
Developer Tools: LabelMe, Power BI, Jupyter Notebook, PyCharm, Google Colab, MySQL Workbench, MS Excel/Google Sheets,
VS Code, Anaconda
Soft Skills: Analytical Thinking, Problem-Solving, Communication Skills, Collaboration, Critical Thinking, Team
profile_data.headline: MS in Computer Science @ SDSU | Actively Seeking Summer Internships 2025 | Data Analytics | Machine Learning

experience.description:
- Managed a batch of 75+ students, providing academic support in Machine Learning and Business System Analysis and Design concepts.
- Graded assignments and projects, ensuring fair and timely evaluation of student work.
- Conducted office hours and doubt-solving sessions to assist students with coursework, coding assignments, and theoretical concepts.
- Collaborated with faculty to enhance course delivery and improve student learning outcomes.
experience.title: Graduate/Research Assistant

experience.description:
- Improved shortcomings in the sales pipeline by customizing Salesforce CRM workflows, using Excel’s data visualization tools (charts and slicers) to analyze trends, and presenting insights to stakeholders, improving lead tracking and conversion rates by 20%.
- Performed inventory analysis by combining Salesforce CRM data with Excel’s advanced filtering (custom auto filters and search filters) and conditional formatting (highlighting duplicates, top/bottom rules) to identify trends and optimize reorder points, reducing holding costs by 18%.
- Improved on-time delivery rates from 80% to 95% by collaborating with stakeholders across sales and logistics, tracking performance with Salesforce reports, and renegotiating vendor contracts with penalty clauses for delays.
experience.title: Data Analyst

experience.description:
- Transformed raw data into actionable business insights using advanced Excel functions, Pivot Tables, and SQL, streamlining data cleaning and preprocessing workflows.
- Optimized the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system by managing and updating lead data daily, enhancing the company’s ability to track and capitalize on potential business opportunities.
- Addressed frequent reporting delays caused by manual data consolidation and validation across multiple sources by integrating SQL for data extraction and transformation, reducing manual processing time by 30% and improving error detection efficiency by 20%.
- Managed large datasets using MS Excel and SQL, employing tools like VLOOKUP, SQL joins, and Pivot Tables to cross-reference, merge, and summarize sales and marketing data, ensuring consistency and accuracy in consolidated reports.
- Designed intuitive, interactive Power BI dashboards to enhance data visualization and reporting, enabling leadership to make swift, data-backed decisions.
- Conducted descriptive analysis to uncover new lead generation strategies, contributing to a 6% increase in lead acquisition and improving lead quality and conversion rates.
experience.title: Database Management Engineer

experience.description:
- Gained hands-on experience in developing and optimizing machine learning models in Jupyter, contributing to multiple high-impact projects.
- Applied advanced machine learning techniques, including Principal Component Analysis (PCA) for dimensionality reduction, as well as linear and logistic regression for predictive modeling.
- Maintained high model accuracy and reliability by implementing robust data cleaning and preprocessing methods using Python libraries like Pandas and NumPy.
- Delivered precise, data-driven insights that improved the accuracy of predictive models and supported strategic decision-making.
experience.title: Machine Learning Intern

experience.description:
- Resolved inaccuracies in human action detection model caused due to poor-quality datasets which previously resulted in unreliable analytics.
- Collected and annotated over 10,000 video frames from CCTV footage using LabelMe, ensuring consistency by adhering to detailed labeling guidelines.
- Developed Python scripts to standardize annotations and convert them into JSON format ensuring seamless integration with analytics workflows.
- Conducted verification processes to identify and correct misannotations, improving dataset accuracy by 20% which enhanced model accuracy by 8% compared to initial benchmarks
experience.title: Data Annotation Engineer

education.schoolName: Shri T P Bhatia College of Science

publications.name: Sanskrit Voice to Text
publications.publisher: International Journal of Scientific Research in Engineering and Management
publications.description: The Sanskrit language has been an important part of Indian culture and heritage for thousands of years. It is one of the oldest languages in the world and has been used for religious and philosophical purposes throughout history. However, with the advent of modern technology, the use and study of Sanskrit have become more challenging. One of the significant difficulties in studying the language is the lack of efficient tools to analyze and interpret the vast amount of Sanskrit texts available. To address this issue, we developed a Sanskrit speech recognition application that can accurately recognize spoken Sanskrit words and convert them into text format. The project utilizes the latest advances in speech recognition technology and machine learning algorithms to achieve high accuracy and precision in recognizing spoken Sanskrit.

honors.description: The project was to develop an Automatic Speech Recognition System (ASR) for the Sanskrit language. The project revolved around different domains such as Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, and Deep Neural Networks. The aim of creating this ASR system was to give Sanskrit speech as input and get the corresponding Sanskrit text output. This project led to a whole new exposure to a variety of domains.

member.occupation: MS in Computer Science @ SDSU | Actively Seeking Summer Internships 2025 | Data Analytics | Machine Learning

projects.description: Developed an ASR system for Sanskrit, achieving a WER of 7.64% on 78 hours of speech data (46,000 sentences). Applied NLP techniques like n-gram models and LSTMs, and experimented with HMM, CNN, and ML acoustic models, with the best results from an end-to-end CTC model. Optimized the CTC model by addressing token independence and improving text normalization, enhancing model accuracy. This system streamlines workflow for Sanskrit authors, reducing their typing workload through accurate speech-to-text conversion.
projects.title: Sanskrit Automatic Speech Recognition System

member.occupation: MS in Computer Science @ SDSU | Actively Seeking Summer Internships 2025 | Data Analytics | Machine Learning

projects.description: Developed a data-driven platform to help users identify ideal restaurant locations, cuisine preferences, and pricing strategies. Scraped and processed restaurant data using Beautiful Soup and Pandas, building predictive models with Random Forest and Decision Tree algorithms. Selected Random Forest for its superior accuracy in predicting ratings. Deployed the model via an interactive web interface using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, allowing users to make informed decisions based on the analysis.
projects.title: Zomato Restaurant Analysis And Prediction
